description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 2a). Physical description: 21-22 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Verses of poetry and several inscriptions on fol. 1a-b and 175b; a note in pencil on fol. 1a attributed the verses to Shaykh al-Islām Najm al-Dīn al-Ghazzī, author of al-Kawākib al-sāʾirah fī aʻyān al-miʻah al-ʻāshirah. Corner of some leaves replaced with the text re-written on the repair. Stained with water and humidity ; mildew. Two labels pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover, one with an inscription in Arabic script reading: "Raqm 26" (repeated on fol. 1a), the other with an inscription in Roman script reading: "H 18". Origin: According to colophon, copied by Yūsuf ibn Aḥmad al-Ṣafadī for himself, from an authograph dated Damascus, Dhū al-Qaʻdah 754 [1353] (the name of the author reads: ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd al-Kāfī al-Subkī al-Shāfiʻī). The copy was completed in the middle decade of Jumādá al-Ākhirah 811 or 814 [1408 or 1411] (fol. 174a). Incipit: بسم ... رب يسر واعن حرف الدال داود بن نبدار بن ابرهيم الجيلي ابو سليمان درس الفقه
author: Subkī, Tāj al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn ʻAlī, approximately 1327-1370
abstract: Second part of al-Ṭabaqāt al-Shāfiʻīyah al-wusṭá.
extent: 175 leaves: paper ; 178 x 134 (135 x 100) mm. bound 178 x 140 mm.
provenance: Six ownership statements on fol. 2a (some erased), including one in the name of Taqī al-Dīn al-Ḥusaynī al-Ḥaṣabī, dated 1090 H. ; one in the name of al-Ḥājj Muḥammad ibn Khalīl al-Baghdādī, who acquired this vol. from Ibn Farrūkh and vol. 1 from al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh al-Baṣrawī, dated 1160 H. ; one in the name of Aḥmad al-Farrūkhī, dated 1223 H.(?). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
contributor: Ghazzī, Najm al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad, 1570-1651
غزي، نجم الدين محمد بن محمد
creator: Subkī, Tāj al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn ʻAlī, approximately 1327-1370
سبكي، تاج الدين عبد الوهاب بن علي
subject: Shaffites—Biography—Dictionaries—History—14th century—Sources
binding_note: Green-dyed fabric over paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers. Paper pastedowns.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
